title: 'There's no loyalties in football': Glen Johnson believes Harry Kane should QUIT Tottenham
text:
Former England defender Glen Johnson has urged Harry Kane to quit Tottenham Hotspur and sign for champions Manchester City.

Kane failed to find the target as Spurs slumped to a shock 3-0 defeat at Brighton on Saturday, and Johnson believes Kane has to be greedy and put his personal ambitions before club allegiances.

'If I was in Harry's shoes, I would think that I can play elsewhere and have a much better chance of playing with better players and adding trophies to my cabinet,' Johnson told BetDaq.

Harry Kane was a vision of frustration against Brighton on what was a terrible day for Spurs

Kane was a spectator at the inaugural NFL game at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium on Sunday

'In a couple of years his goals could dry up at Spurs and he'd be out the door.

'There's no loyalties in football and he has to look after himself first and foremost.'

Kane was jeered when he appeared at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium for the Chicago Bears against the Oakland Raiders NFL match on Sunday evening.

The England captain has scored 171 goals in 263 Tottenham appearances, and has seven in 10 so far this season, but his strikes can't arrest Spurs' worrying drop in form.

And Johnson is adamant Kane could flourish at Manchester City in the future, and should therefore resist temptation to move abroad.

Glen Johnson won the Premier League with Chelsea in 2004-05 and made 54 England caps

'I don't think he'd be suited to the Spanish style of playing, so he might have to wait for Sergio Aguero to move on at City before going there,' said Johnson.

'But it's not out of the question that could happen in my opinion.

'If I was Harry, I know what I'd do, I'd be moving on for the sake of my career to win as much as I could.'
